pullRequest.body:
Complete the API and follow the convention that `Cardinal.mk` is called `card` and `Nat.card` is called `natCard` in lemma names.

From LeanCamCombi

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #17234

Please cut this into multiple PRs; currently this one is doing too much:

- New API lemmas
- File renames
- New attributes
- Lemma renames

Please also follow the mathlib PR commit conventions: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html

I've split off #17233 and #17234. I don't think there is much point splitting off much more than that:
* The names that are made free by rename are immediately reused
* The files are deconstructed and reconstructed rather than renamed

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17234~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> follow the convention that `Cardinal.mk` is called `card`

Is this actually an established convention?

> > follow the convention that `Cardinal.mk` is called `card`
> 
> Is this actually an established convention?

It doesn't seem like it - almost all the lemmas about Cardinal.mk are called `mk` rather than `card`.

I think it would actually be worth renaming `Cardinal.mk` to `Cardinal.card`. We can't just unnamespace `Cardinal.mk` in lemma names because it's obviously ambiguous so we would have to call it `cardinalMk`, and informal mathematics calls it the "cardinality" of the type. The fact that it's the constructor is actually quite accessory in the grand scheme of things.
Perhaps, but it's not a change that should be made in this PR, and it's a change that should have some further discussion. Please revert it for this PR and correct the description.
(which leaves the `card` names available to hold deprecations in the meantime)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11407421350/job/31743382193)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11407421350/job/31743381918)

Thanks!

bors merge
Please read and follow the PR title conventions. You can find them here: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html

Thanks!

bors merge
This rename looks worthy of its own PR
Stuffed it in #17234
Arguably deprecations are needed here and throughout this PR.
The names are reused
`cardinalMk` is not the correct name for these things. Please use `mk`, which is the mathlib convention.

You can get yourself acquainted with the mathlib naming convention here: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html#identifiers-and-theorem-names

This passage in particular is relevant:
> When referring to a namespaced definition in a lemma name not in the same namespace, the definition should have its namespace removed. If the definition name is unambiguous without its namespace, it can be used as is. Else, the namespace is prepended back to it in `lowerCamelCase`. This is to ensure that `_`-separated strings in a lemma name correspond to a definition name or connective.
Indeed, that passage is relevant, and it indicates that this lemma should be in the cardinal namespace.
What? It's already in the `Set` namespace since it's primarily about sets.
Note that almost all lemmas involving the cardinality of sets are in the Cardinal namespace, not the Set namespace. As such, this one should be as well.
Don't forget to rename this one too.
optional - is it not easier to prove this by going via image2?
Well spotted

This looks like a lot of unnecessary cases. Something like this looks like it'll work
```
lemma natCard_mul_le : Nat.card (s * t) ‚â§ Nat.card s * Nat.card t := by
  obtain h | h := (s * t).finite_or_infinite
  case inr => simp [Set.Infinite.card_eq_zero h]
  simp only [Nat.card, ‚Üê Cardinal.toNat_mul]
  refine Cardinal.toNat_le_toNat Cardinal.mk_mul_le ?_
  aesop (add simp [Cardinal.mul_lt_aleph0_iff, finite_mul])
```
No, this is really necessary. When you don't have cancellativity of multiplication, it's very possible for `s` and `t` to be infinite but `s * t` to be finite, in which case the statement is false
I don't follow. The proof I gave works, and does so in fewer cases and fewer lines. Which part are you objecting to?
Ah, the use of cancellativity is hidden inside the`aesop` call Makes sense

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: more lemmas about the size of pointwise sets
